title: Trapdoor Mesh Network Fully Deployed
summary:
Deployed trapdoor mesh network across 5 machines (2026-01-08):

Hub Server: ws://100.70.207.76:8081/v1/ws/agent (running on black)

Machines:
- black (100.70.207.76): Orchestrator + Qwen 2.5 Coder 32B + Hub
- silver-fox (100.121.212.93): Mac server + Ollama (needs local models, disk 93% full)
- nvidia-spark (100.73.240.125): GPU node + Ollama + 3.4TB free + NVIDIA GB10
- white (100.115.250.119): Windows + Home Assistant (deployment ready)
- neon (100.80.193.92): Docker mothership (container prepped)

MCP Server Tools (10 available):
1. trapdoor_connect - Join mesh
2. trapdoor_status - Check connection
3. trapdoor_find_agents - Discover other Claudes
4. trapdoor_send_task - Delegate to other Claudes
5. trapdoor_check_messages - Receive tasks
6. trapdoor_broadcast - Message all agents
7. trapdoor_send_file - Send file to another machine
8. trapdoor_request_file - Get file from another machine
9. trapdoor_handle_file_transfers - Process incoming files
10. trapdoor_local_execute - Run commands via trapdoor
11. trapdoor_local_chat - Chat with local Qwen

Verified Working:
- Cross-machine file transfer (black → silver-fox)
- Agent discovery and coordination
- Hub message routing
- Local AI inference on black (Qwen)

Next Steps:
- Deploy models to nvidia-spark (it's massively underutilized)
- Free space on silver-fox, pull local models
- Complete white and neon deployments

title: LLM Infrastructure Across Mesh Network
summary:
Local LLM resources available across trapdoor mesh (2026-01-08):

black (100.70.207.76):
- Qwen 2.5 Coder 32B via Ollama (VERIFIED WORKING)
- OpenAI API backend available
- Anthropic API backend available
- Trapdoor server: http://localhost:8080

nvidia-spark (100.73.240.125):
- NVIDIA GB10 GPU + CUDA 13.0
- 119GB RAM, 3.4TB free storage
- Ollama running (systemd service)
- Currently: llama3.2:3b (2GB only)
- MASSIVELY UNDERUTILIZED - can host 20+ models
- Recommended: Pull qwen2.5-coder:7b, llama3.3:70b, deepseek-r1:7b, mixtral:8x7b

silver-fox (100.121.212.93):
- Ollama running but disk 93% full (7% free)
- Only remote cloud models currently
- 4.5TB external drive available
- Needs: Free 20GB, move storage to external, pull local models

Usage Pattern:
- Small queries → 7B models on silver-fox
- Code tasks → Qwen on black or nvidia-spark
- Large reasoning → 70B+ on nvidia-spark GPU
- Quick local → Qwen on black (no latency)

title: Cross-Machine File Transfer via Trapdoor Mesh
summary:
File transfer between machines via trapdoor mesh network works (verified 2026-01-08):

Protocol:
1. Sender uses trapdoor_send_file(agent_id, file_path, remote_save_path)
2. File read via local trapdoor /fs/read endpoint (uses security system)
3. Content sent through WebSocket hub to target agent
4. Receiver processes with trapdoor_handle_file_transfers()
5. Text files saved via trapdoor /fs/write (security), binary direct (limitation)
6. ACK sent back to sender

Test Results:
- black → silver-fox: SUCCESS (87 byte text file)
- File content verified identical
- ACK confirmation received
- Transfer took ~3 seconds

Encoding:
- Text files: Plain text (UTF-8)
- Binary files: Base64 encoded

Security Note:
- Text files go through trapdoor security system
- Binary files bypass security (direct filesystem write)
- Acceptable in trusted Tailscale mesh

Next: Test reverse (silver-fox → black) and black ↔ nvidia-spark
